intro: Erica eriocephala, commonly known as the woolly heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth and small, needle-like leaves covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the branches. Erica eriocephala thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation, particularly in coastal areas.
